intro: Betula platyphylla var. phellodendroides, commonly known as the Chinese birch, is a variant of the paper birch native to eastern Asia. It is characterized by its smooth, white bark that peels in thin layers, giving it a distinctive appearance. The leaves are typically triangular and have a serrated edge, turning yellow in the autumn. This species is often found in mountainous regions and thrives in cool, moist climates. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
